content:
• Friday, September 2, 2011
  • RBS

    Perry Corp., a hedge fund run by former Goldman Sachs banker Richard Perry, has reportedly taken...

    Perry Corp., a hedge fund run by former Goldman Sachs banker Richard Perry, has reportedly taken a 10.65% stake in Royal Bank of Scotland (NYSE:RBS). Shares +1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM

  • Comex gold soared nearly $50, or 2.6%, to $1,877.20/oz., capping a 10% gain for the week. Silver...

    Comex gold soared nearly $50, or 2.6%, to $1,877.20/oz., capping a 10% gain for the week. Silver jumped 3.8% to $43.12 an ounce, gaining 5.2% on the week. On the opposite end, New York crude tumbled 2.9% to $86.33/barrel, and nat gas fell 4.7% to $3.86/MMBtu.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment

  • New records are set in the Treasury bond market: 10-year yield settles at a record low close of...

    New records are set in the Treasury bond market: 10-year yield settles at a record low close of 1.996%, 5-year sees record low close of 0.87%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 1 Comment

  • Methode Electronics ( MEI -4%) continues its decline following yesterday's earnings miss as...

    Methode Electronics ( MEI -4%) continues its decline following yesterday's earnings miss as Baird cuts its target price. The firm cites choppy margins and a volatile earnings picture due to increasing costs tied to the launch of its new business line.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM

  • The yield on the 10 year Treasury note dips below 2%.

    The yield on the 10 year Treasury note dips below 2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • NFLX

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield expects Netflix (NFLX -9.1%) and Starz (LSTZA -1.2%) to come back to...

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield expects Netflix (NFLX -9.1%) and Starz (LSTZA -1.2%) to come back to the negotiating table and eventually sign a deal: "Why does Netflix want to let someone else have access to Starz’s unique movie content, and can anyone really pay Starz as much as Netflix... Stay tuned, we expect there is more to this story..." (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 7 Comments
  • REGN

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.8%) are higher today on the news of rival Roche's...

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.8%) are higher today on the news of rival Roche's Avastin problems. Its own macular degeneration treatment Eylea, which competes with Avastin, is currently awaiting FDA approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • GPT

    Gramercy Capital (GKK), a property investment and real estate finance company, gains 14.2% after...

    Gramercy Capital (GKK), a property investment and real estate finance company, gains 14.2% after announcing the settlement of $549.7M in senior and junior mezzanine loans, with 317 properties initially given up as part of the deal. Analyst Ben Thypin thinks what's left of Gramercy after the deal could be a compelling acquisition target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • SENEA

    Seneca Foods (SENEA -5.6%) trades lower after saying it's terminated merger negotiations with...

    Seneca Foods (SENEA -5.6%) trades lower after saying it's terminated merger negotiations with private canned food processor Allens Inc.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -8%) bounces back somewhat, but is still trading lower after...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -8%) bounces back somewhat, but is still trading lower after selling a 6.25M block of shares to institutional investors at $1.11, a 19% discount to yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB -8.3%) takes a hit after Wedbush cuts the stock to underperform. The company is...

    Talbots (TLB -8.3%) takes a hit after Wedbush cuts the stock to underperform. The company is cash constrained, Wedbush says, and its conservative customer base isn't likely to increase spending over the near term due to deteriorating economic conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • KATE

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ) gains 5.9% after announcing the sale of its money-losing Mexx brand to a...

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ) gains 5.9% after announcing the sale of its money-losing Mexx brand to a joint venture formed with a PE firm, with the latter claiming an 81.25% stake. Wall Street Strategies' Brian Sozzi sees the move as a positive, claiming Mexx "has been the black sheep" of Liz Clairborne's portfolio of apparel brands.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • ODFL

    Old Dominion Freight (ODFL +0.2%) clings to positive territory after getting upgraded to...

    Old Dominion Freight (ODFL +0.2%) clings to positive territory after getting upgraded to outperform at Credit Suisse on valuation, citing improvements in management execution and the build-out of its freight network.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • PG

    Shares of companies considered non-cyclical are outperforming other sectors in the wake of the...

    Shares of companies considered non-cyclical are outperforming other sectors in the wake of the jobs report fiasco. Dow components Procter & Gamble (PG -0.5%) and Coca-Cola (KO -0.7%) only show a small loss, while J.M. Smucker (SJM +0.2%) and Diamond Foods (DMND +0.1%) are even edging out a small gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • GMRRQ

    Moody's Investors Service cuts General Maritime (GMR -3.2%) three notches and leaves the door...

    Moody's Investors Service cuts General Maritime (GMR -3.2%) three notches and leaves the door open for an additional downgrade, saying the oil-tanker's liquidity is still draining while rates continue to come down.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • EDMC

    Education Management (EDMC +2%) trades higher on a Morgan Stanley valuation upgrade to...

    Education Management (EDMC +2%) trades higher on a Morgan Stanley valuation upgrade to equalweight. Morgan says the stock's in line with its $16 price target, but could still gain from potential sizeable buybacks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • WBC

    WABCO (WBC +2.7%) holds on to gains after reiterating FY11 guidance earlier, saying revenue will...

    WABCO (WBC +2.7%) holds on to gains after reiterating FY11 guidance earlier, saying revenue will grow between 22% and 25% and its EPS should range from $4.55 to $4.80, the high-end of the range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • FNSR

    As optical component and subsystem vendor Finisar (FNSR +15.9%) takes off following its strong...

    As optical component and subsystem vendor Finisar (FNSR +15.9%) takes off following its strong FQ1 results and FQ2 guidance, smaller rival Oclaro (OCLR +11%) is also moving sharply higher. Competitors JDS Uniphase (JDSU +2.9%) and Opnext (OPXT +2.6%) are posting relatively modest gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • MGN

    Mines Management (MGN +5%) bucks the downtrend this morning after Roth Capital initiates the...

    Mines Management (MGN +5%) bucks the downtrend this morning after Roth Capital initiates the stock with a buy rating and a price target of $5.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -4.4%) shares slump after Robert W. Baird cuts its price target to $14 from $20...

    Dendreon (DNDN -4.4%) shares slump after Robert W. Baird cuts its price target to $14 from $20 and lowers its sales forecast for its Provenge prostate cancer drug. Oncologists say they haven't been reimbursed yet for the drug because of Medicare and regional carrier issues, according to Baird's research note.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2%) is one of today's few gainers after a report says Soliris,...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2%) is one of today's few gainers after a report says Soliris, the company's only drug, may be found to treat other rare diseases besides the life-threatening blood disorder PNH. The company expects the FDA to decide if Soliris can be marketed to treat a rare kidney disease as early as Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI -5%) trades lower this morning after admitting it made misleading...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI -5%) trades lower this morning after admitting it made misleading statements by citing FDA "approval" for three of its new OTC drugs when it should have said they were "compliant."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • FWONA

    Content from Starz (LSTZA -2.3%) accounts for ~8% of streaming activity for Netflix (NFLX...

    Content from Starz (LSTZA -2.3%) accounts for ~8% of streaming activity for Netflix (NFLX -9.4%), and its loss could be "disastrous," Janney believes; "a loss of subs could leave NFLX struggling to pay the [$2.4B] in off balance sheet content obligations." But Caris thinks investors "should applaud NFLX for exercising a great deal of financial discipline in refusing to bend to Starz’ demand."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • OMX

    Shares of Staples (STPLS -4.4%) and Officemax (OMX -5.1%) are steep decliners on the negative...

    Shares of Staples (STPLS -4.4%) and Officemax (OMX -5.1%) are steep decliners on the negative outlook for employment. In particular, investors may be absorbing the terrible private-sector job number as a bad omen for office supply spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • KMG

    KMG Chemicals (KMGB -5.5%) trades lower this morning after warning its FQ4 earnings will fall...

    KMG Chemicals (KMGB -5.5%) trades lower this morning after warning its FQ4 earnings will fall far short of expectations due to its inability to pass on escalating raw-material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBUX

    Specialty tea retailer Teavana (TEA), which soared following its July IPO, is down 8.7% after...

    Specialty tea retailer Teavana (TEA), which soared following its July IPO, is down 8.7% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $31.3M (+36% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.03 - no Street forecasts yet. Same-store sales rose 6.9% (exc. e-commerce). Teavana expects FY11 revenue of $160M-$164M, and EPS of $0.42-$0.44, and plans to open 50 new stores on the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • RCL

    Shares of Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL -4.4%) lose ground after Tropical Storm Katia's track map...

    Shares of Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL -4.4%) lose ground after Tropical Storm Katia's track map suggests it's likely the operations of the cruise line operator will be disrupted again. Last time around, the company took a damaging PR hit when it had to compensate passengers left stranded when its ship left early in advance of Hurricane Irene.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • BP

    BP says the lawsuit that led to two raids on its Moscow office was "absurd," as it looks to set...

    BP says the lawsuit that led to two raids on its Moscow office was "absurd," as it looks to set aside the Siberian court drama and reopen its office Monday. It's been a busy week for BP's attorneys after Halliburton (HAL -2.1%) also jumped in today with a defamation suit related to the Gulf oil spill. Shares are down 4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • BAC

    Financials limp out of the gate, with weak jobs data piling on already bad news: a federal...

    Financials limp out of the gate, with weak jobs data piling on already bad news: a federal agency is set to sue big banks over misrepresenting the quality of mortgage securities, and the Fed asks BofA (BAC -7.7%) to show contingencies if conditions get worse for the bank.JPM -4.1%, C -5.6%. Financials SPDR (XLF -3%) has dropped more than 14% in three months.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 8 Comments
  • CAT

    Shares of heavy equipment makers are pointing towards a down day. In premarket trading,...

    Shares of heavy equipment makers are pointing towards a down day. In premarket trading, Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) is down 3.4%, Deere (NYSE:DE) is off 2.9% and Joy Global (NYSE:JOY) loses 2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -9%) discloses "a dramatic increase in the short position of its shares," and...

    Silvercorp (SVM -9%) discloses "a dramatic increase in the short position of its shares," and the receipt of an anonymous letter alleging a "potential $1.3B accounting fraud." The firm describes the accusation as "malicious" and offers a point by point rebuttal of the letter.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) is filing suit against BP over last year's Deepwater Horizon explosion,...

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) is filing suit against BP over last year's Deepwater Horizon explosion, accusing the oil giant of providing Halliburton with inaccurate information prior to performing cementing services on the day before the explosion, and omitting this info in subsequent statements, filings, and investigations. BP -4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • KATE

    Premarket gainers: LIZ +10%. FNSR +8%. GSS +4%. HL +3%. SLW +3%.Losers: NFLX -10%. BAC -7%. BTU...

    Premarket gainers: LIZ +10%. FNSR +8%. GSS +4%. HL +3%. SLW +3%.
    Losers: NFLX -10%. BAC -7%. BTU -7%. C -6%. CMO -5%. BP -5%. MT -4%. CLWR -4%. STD -4%. LVLT -4%. TS -4%. RF -4%. DB -3%. CYS -3%. DRYS -3%. AGNC -3%. S -3%. SINA -3%. CAT -3%. BIDU -3%. WFC -3%. MGM -3%. IVR -3%. ATPG -3%. BCS -3%. RAD -3%. MS -3%. ANH -3%. AMD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) fall 2.5% premarket after a weak job report hits. Other...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) fall 2.5% premarket after a weak job report hits. Other staffing firms in the line of fire after the market opens: KELYA, MAN, RHI, NSP.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • FXF

    Already up on the day, the Swiss franc bolts even higher following the NFP report, now +2.6% vs....

    Already up on the day, the Swiss franc bolts even higher following the NFP report, now +2.6% vs. the dollar, +2.8% vs. the euro. FXF +2.4% premarket. The greenback is mixed vs. the other major currencies.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM

  • Treasurys spike following the jobs number goose-egg - with the 30-year +1.15% to 140-09 and the...

    Treasurys spike following the jobs number goose-egg - with the 30-year +1.15% to 140-09 and the 10-year +0.49% to 131-08. 2-year up just 0.01%. Crude -2.25% to $86.92. Gold +2.1% to $1,868.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM

  • S&P futures -1.4% in the wake of the weak NFP report. Europe dives to new lows, the Stoxx 50...

    S&P futures -1.4% in the wake of the weak NFP report. Europe dives to new lows, the Stoxx 50 -3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) falls 3.3% premarket after assessing the impact from a roof failure at...

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) falls 3.3% premarket after assessing the impact from a roof failure at its Goonyella Mine in Queensland. The company estimates a full-year effect on earnings of up to $175M, pushing its EPS estimate down to $3.70-$4.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -2.8%) falls premarket as legal troubles for the lender continue to mount....

    Bank of America (BAC -2.8%) falls premarket as legal troubles for the lender continue to mount. The other banks specifically named as possibly getting sued by the FHFA: Deutsche Bank (DB -2.5%), JPMorgan (JPM -0.9%), Goldman Sachs (GS -0.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca's (NYSE:AZN) blockbuster cholesterol drug Crestor failed to beat Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE)...

    AstraZeneca's (NYSE:AZN) blockbuster cholesterol drug Crestor failed to beat Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE) Lipitor in a head-to-head study. The result is likely to cap any benefits AZN might have gained from when Lipitor loses its patent in November and cheap generics hit the market. Shares -3.3% in London. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 AM
